meanings.definition: A person under the legal age of adulthood.
meanings.sent1: Minors must be accompanied by an adult at the movie theater.
meanings.sent2: The store had a special section for minors' clothing.
meanings.sent3: Why did the minor bring a giant teddy bear to the playground?
meanings.sent4: In the land of adults, minors are like curious kittens.
meanings.sent5: The playground was filled with the laughter of minors playing.

meanings.definition: Smaller or lesser in size, extent, or importance.
meanings.sent1: The minor key on the piano creates a melancholic sound.
meanings.sent2: The minor details in the painting added depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The minor snowflake landed softly on the tip of her nose.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean, the minor island seemed insignificant.
meanings.sent5: Her minor mistake in the recipe changed the flavor of the dish.

meanings.definition: A subject or area of study chosen as a secondary field of specialization.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pursue psychology as a minor in college.
meanings.sent2: The minor in art history complemented her major in biology.
meanings.sent3: The minor in astronomy made her see the stars in a new light.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, the minor in music theory was essential.
meanings.sent5: His minor in economics broadened his understanding of the market.
